item.title:
usage of our new features from devday is far outpacing our expectations.
we were planning to go live with GPTs for all subscribers monday but still haven’t been able to. we are hoping to soon.
there will likely be service instability in the short term due to load. sorry :/
item.content:encoded:

item.title: R to @sama: (there is nuance in saying "regulate us, but not smaller competitors" that somehow ends up getting lost and we just get bashed, but i think it's important enough to be worth it.)
item.content:encoded: (there is nuance in saying "regulate us, but not smaller competitors" that somehow ends up getting lost and we just get bashed, but i think it's important enough to be worth it.)

item.title:
there are some great parts about the AI EO, but as the govt implements it, it will be important not to slow down innovation by smaller companies/research teams.
i am pro-regulation on frontier systems, which is what openai has been calling for, and against regulatory capture.
item.content:encoded:
there are some great parts about the AI EO, but as the govt implements it, it will be important not to slow down innovation by smaller companies/research teams.

i am pro-regulation on frontier systems, which is what openai has been calling for, and against regulatory capture.

item.title:
this is interesting, and i think close to what the majority of voters actually want:
a reasonable, centrist candidate running on 1) a message of a strong economy and increasing affordability 2) a focus on safety and 3) generational change.
curious to see what happens.
item.content:encoded:
this is interesting, and i think close to what the majority of voters actually want:

a reasonable, centrist candidate running on 1) a message of a strong economy and increasing affordability 2) a focus on safety and 3) generational change.

curious to see what happens.

item.title: R to @sama: also, if you are good at thinking about how the bad guys think, try our new preparedness challenge focused on novel insights around model misuse.

item.title:
we are launching a new preparedness team to evaluate, forecast, and protect against AI risk led by @aleks_madry.
we aim to set a new high-water mark for quantitative, evidence-based work.
https://openai.com/blog/frontier-risk-and-preparedness

item.title:
plans should be measured in decades, execution should be measured in weeks.
you gotta have both.
item.content:encoded:
plans should be measured in decades, execution should be measured in weeks.

you gotta have both.

item.title:
you are listening to the new blink 182 album for the 17th time today and about to play the new mario with your friends who brought over mountain dew.
you ordered dominos with a discount code your mom gave you, $10/pizza.
the year is 2023, and you are 38 years old. life is good
item.content:encoded:

you ordered dominos with a discount code your mom gave you, $10/pizza.

the year is 2023, and you are 38 years old. life is good

item.title: man blink 182 still crushes it after all these years
item.content:encoded: man blink 182 still crushes it after all these years

item.title:
R to @sama: maybe most importantly, he will offer unwavering support on bad days.
he does this quietly in the background and never asks for anything other than learning about AI.
most companies have someone like this in their history, but they never get enough credit. thank you, brian.
item.content:encoded:
maybe most importantly, he will offer unwavering support on bad days.

he does this quietly in the background and never asks for anything other than learning about AI.

most companies have someone like this in their history, but they never get enough credit. thank you, brian.

item.title:
many people have reached out to offer help and advice over the past year; no one has gotten close to @bchesky in terms of delivering.
he will take a midnight call any time, put in hours of work on any topic, answer difficult questions correctly/with clarity, make any intro, etc

item.title: i expect ai to be capable of superhuman persuasion well before it is superhuman at general intelligence, which may lead to some very strange outcomes

item.title: born too late to explore the earth, born...at the absolute coolest time in history, about to be able to explore absolutely everything else
item.content:encoded: born too late to explore the earth, born...at the absolute coolest time in history, about to be able to explore absolutely everything else

item.title:
i wish the world were studying solar geoengineering more.
clearly have misgivings about it, but it's so relatively cheap that i think some country is just going to do it if/when the climate crisis gets bad enough as a temporary patch.
would be great to learn more before then.
item.content:encoded:

clearly have misgivings about it, but it's so relatively cheap that i think some country is just going to do it if/when the climate crisis gets bad enough as a temporary patch.
